page.title: 08LOCAL AMENITIES
page.content: I interviewed several people about their views on the amenities in and around Ruislip.The responses showed that the facilities are thought to be fairly adequate.One person commented, however,that most of the amenities are for teenagers,leaving the middle-aged people with clubs,a leisure centre and swimming pool.The Elderly are reasonably well catered for,having day centres,homes and various assorted clubs.Additional amenities suggested were:a local cinema,a citizens advice bureau and more non-sponsored youth clubs.Views on the cuts were that opportunities had been cut for mainly young people,and things like reduced grass mowing,for example,meant that children play ball in the streets causing danger.The loss of amenities would encourage vandalism, which would affect the community as a whole.
